meanings.definition: Drawbores (verb): to make a hole slightly off-center in one piece of wood so that when a peg is driven through it, it will draw the pieces tightly together.
meanings.sent1: He carefully drawbores the wood to ensure a snug fit.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter drawbores the joints for a strong connection.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to drawbores its acorn into the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her determination drawbores through any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The drawbores technique creates a bond that cannot be easily broken.

meanings.definition: Drawbores (noun): a hole made in this way.
meanings.sent1: The drawbores in the wood aligned perfectly.
meanings.sent2: She inserted the peg into the drawbores with precision.
meanings.sent3: The drawbores resembled tiny tunnels in the wood.
meanings.sent4: The drawbores acted as anchors for the structure.
meanings.sent5: Each drawbores served a specific purpose in the construction.
